tweet: When NEPA takes the light and you suddenly become the Flash, navigating your way through the furniture like a boss!
The feeling when you successfully negotiate with the danfo conductor and get your 50 naira change back... Epic victory dance!
There are two types of people in this world: those who lick the Indomie seasoning and those who lie about not licking it.
You know you're in Lagos when you spend more time in traffic than actually doing anything else.
That moment when you try to form an accent and end up sounding like a mix of Wizkid and a robot.
When someone says 'food is ready,' forget your age and status, we all run like Usain Bolt to the dining table!
African parents be like, 'If you die in that game, I will kill you!'
Who else is guilty of scrolling through their phone with a straight face and suddenly bursting out in laughter in public?

If you can survive Naija jollof wars, you can conquer anything in life!
When you finally get your favorite seat in the lecture hall and feel like a boss.
That 'Did You Beat Me?' look your mom gives you after you both know she won the argument.
When you spot the last piece of puff-puff at a party, and it's like a treasure hunt!
The struggle of trying to dance Shaku Shaku when you have two left feet.
When you hear 'Owanbe' is around the corner and you become an uninvited guest's professional.
Nigerian movie villains be like, 'I'll deal with you' but never actually getting anything done.
When you see your crush coming, and your 'swag' level suddenly hits 1000.
Trying to reply with 'Okay' to your parents' WhatsApp message without sounding disrespectful.
The face you make when you hear 'Had I Known' after missing an opportunity.
When you wake up from a long nap and have no idea what year it is.
Nigerian aunties have a PhD in squeezing your cheeks like a ripe mango.
That awkward moment when your phone rings loudly during a serious church sermon.
Trying to leave a family gathering without attracting the 'You're going already?' interrogation.
When you're the only one laughing at your dad's dry jokes, but you gotta show support.
You know Christmas is near when the harmattan breeze slaps your face like a jilted lover.
When you find out your crush is a 'professional text-replier' and you start questioning your life choices.
That awkward silence in the classroom after someone asks a 'stupid' question.
When you check your account balance expecting millions but find 'Sorry, try again' instead.
The struggle of trying to chew 'Kpomo' silently, but it sounds like a construction site.
When your favorite song comes on, and you suddenly transform into a backup dancer.
That moment when you successfully predict the next dialogue in a Nollywood movie.
When you finally crack the code to your mom's 'eye language' and understand her warnings.

When you're trying to save money, but then you hear 'Owambe' drumming from a distance.
Walking into a dark room, suddenly feeling like the lead character in a Nollywood horror movie.
When your favorite food vendor increases the price, and you act like you're not offended.
The art of pretending to like your friend's taste in music when it's pure noise to your ears.
That mini heart attack when you mistakenly open the front camera in a public place.
The stress of replying to a long WhatsApp message with just an emoji.
When you step into the rain and your expensive hairstyle turns into a science experiment.
Trying to act unbothered after an insect decides to do a marathon on your skin.
When your parents use your full name, and you know you're in for a long lecture.
The confusion of trying to pronounce your own name correctly when introducing yourself.
When your phone autocorrects 'brb' to 'bribed,' and your friend starts panicking.
Trying to keep a straight face when your sibling is getting scolded for something you did together.
When you finally reach the end of the long queue and the cashier closes for a break.
The awkwardness of trying to explain a meme to someone who has zero internet sense.
When you take the first bite of hot amala and it feels like a dragon breathing fire in your mouth.
Trying to suppress your laughter in a quiet church when someone's stomach growls loudly.
When you finally master the art of folding your 'gele' without needing a Ph.D. in geometry.
The thrill of successfully escaping from your school or office without anyone noticing.
When you spot an empty seat in a crowded 'molue' bus, and it feels like winning the lottery!
That moment when you accidentally send a voice note of you singing off-key instead of a text message.
When you open your exam paper and realize you only know the date and your name.
Trying to look sophisticated while eating roadside 'boli' and 'groundnut' in a fancy outfit.

The struggle of keeping a straight face when someone mispronounces a common word.

That awkward moment when you try to impress your crush with your 'swag,' but end up tripping over air.

That feeling of liberation when the teacher is late, and the whole class becomes a party zone!
When you think you aced the test, but your friend asks, 'How did you solve number 5?'

When you finish your exam early, but the supervisor gives you the 'you're too fast' look.
When you pretend to look busy studying, but you're just rearranging your stationery for the 100th time.

Trying to hold in your laughter while the teacher scolds your friend for a hilarious reason.

The relief of finding out your best friend got the same answer wrong on the test.
When the school bell rings, and you race out of the classroom like you're in a 100-meter dash.
Trying to impress your crush with your sports skills but end up tripping over your own feet.
That moment of panic when you forget your lines during a drama performance.
When your favorite teacher is absent, and you celebrate like it's a national holiday.
The silent communication between you and your friend during a boring class.

The struggle of maintaining a poker face when the teacher cracks a lame joke.
When you and your best friend get detention together and turn it into a party.
That magical moment when the teacher cancels the homework assignment.
Trying to keep your cool when you get caught passing notes in class.
When the teacher calls you to answer a question you have absolutely no clue about.
That one student who always brings extra pens and becomes everyone's savior during exams.
When your friend asks for a piece of your snack, and you become an excellent negotiator.
The struggle of fitting an entire day's worth of homework into the last hour before bedtime.

That feeling of satisfaction when your art project turns out better than you expected.
When you and your friends plan to study together, but it turns into a never-ending gossip session.
Trying to sneakily eat chips in class, and it sounds like a construction site.
When you volunteer to present first in class, and the teacher looks at you like you're an alien.
That moment when you see your teacher outside of school, and they're wearing casual clothes.
When your handwriting looks like modern art, and you pretend you wrote it with your eyes closed.
The feeling of betrayal when the teacher announces a pop quiz with no warning.
When your classmate says they forgot their assignment, but you know they didn't do it.
Trying to take a stealthy nap in class without falling off your chair.
That one friend who always volunteers you for group presentations without asking.
When you hear your teacher saying, 'This won't be on the test,' but you still take notes.
Trying to discreetly look at your crush from across the classroom without getting caught.
When you finish your homework early and feel like a time management guru.
The struggle of carrying a bunch of textbooks, pretending you're on a balancing act.
When the teacher asks if anyone needs help, but you'd rather fail than raise your hand.
That friend who always borrows your notes but never returns them.
Trying to fit a week's worth of gossip into the lunch break like a speed-talker.
When the teacher accidentally writes the answer on the board and erases it immediately.
The art of trading your unwanted snacks with classmates like a stock exchange pro.
When you study so hard for a test, but the only thing you remember is your name.
Trying to hold in your laughter while the principal gives a serious speech.
That one classmate who always raises their hand before the teacher finishes the question.
When the teacher asks if anyone needs a bathroom break, but you're too shy to ask.
The relief of finding out your crush has the same music taste as you do.
Trying to act natural when your stomach growls loudly in a quiet classroom.
When your pen runs out of ink during an exam, and you start sweating like it's a marathon.
That friend who always knows the latest gossip about everyone, including the teachers.

The joy of discovering a new secret study spot that no one else knows about.
When you try to show off your soccer skills during P.E. but accidentally kick the ball away.
That one teacher who always has a perfect answer to your brilliant excuses.
When the class clown gets you laughing, and the teacher thinks you're the instigator.

That friend who never has a pen but always manages to borrow yours.

Trying to find a creative excuse for not doing your homework at the last minute.

That friend who always makes the most elaborate excuses to skip P.E. class.
When you volunteer to pass out the exam papers and feel like a responsible adult.
Trying to act like you understand a complex topic when the teacher calls on you.
When you find an old doodle in your notebook and wonder what was going on in your mind.
That one teacher who never forgets the embarrassing stories from your childhood.

That friend who constantly asks for your notes but never shows up for lectures.
When your teacher catches you passing notes and reads it out loud to the whole class.
Trying to keep a straight face when your friend cracks a hilarious joke during a serious lecture.
When your pen runs out of ink during an exam, and you try to write using your mental powers.
That one student who always asks for extra homework like they're a secret agent.
When the teacher uses your incorrect answer as an example of what not to do.
Trying to be slick by using your calculator for non-math subjects like a secret agent.
That feeling of accomplishment when you finally find a quiet corner to read a book.
When you successfully copy someone's homework, but the teacher doesn't collect it.
Trying to be the 'quiet kid' in class, but your uncontrollable giggles betray you.
That one student who always has the weirdest answers during class discussions.
When your teacher's handwriting is so illegible that you think they're writing in hieroglyphics.
Trying to find a creative excuse for not doing your homework, and you become Shakespeare.
That friend who always brings homemade snacks and turns the classroom into a food fair.
When you accidentally call the teacher 'mom' and try to recover with a fake cough.
Trying to suppress a yawn during the most engaging class discussion.
That moment when you thought you aced the test, but the results say otherwise.
When your friend becomes a human calculator during exams, and you just stare in awe.
Trying to control your excitement when the teacher announces a field trip.
That friend who always asks for gum during exams, and you become a 'gum dispenser.'
When you raise your hand to answer a question confidently, but it turns out to be wrong.
Trying to pretend you're listening to the teacher while mentally planning your weekend.
That one student who always has the perfect answer but never raises their hand.
When your teacher assigns a group project, and you pray for divine intervention.
Trying to walk casually after slipping on a wet floor like you meant to do a dance move.
That feeling of nostalgia when you see your old classroom after moving to a new grade.
When the teacher announces a surprise quiz and you wonder if you've entered the twilight zone.
Trying to hide your face when your teacher compliments you in front of the whole class.
That one friend who always reminds the teacher about the homework they forgot to collect.
When you and your best friend laugh uncontrollably, and no one else gets the joke.
Trying to balance a plate of food, a drink, and your school bag during lunch breaks.
That feeling of accomplishment when your teacher praises your handwriting in the report card.
When you bring your pet for a 'bring your pet to school' day, and it becomes a celebrity.
Trying to hold in your laughter when the substitute teacher mispronounces everyone's names.
That one classmate who always volunteers for the most challenging tasks like a superhero.
When the teacher uses your failed test as an example of what not to do.
Trying to look interested during a boring presentation, but your eyes start to droop.
That feeling of satisfaction when you solve a difficult math problem all by yourself.
When you and your friends have an entire conversation using only inside jokes.
Trying to be invisible when the teacher asks for a volunteer, and you avoid eye contact.
That one student who always manages to argue with the teacher and win the debate.
When you see the teacher carrying a stack of graded papers and hope yours isn't at the bottom.
When you finally find the TV remote after turning the whole house upside down, only to realize it was in your pocket all along.
When you're trying to take the perfect selfie, but the camera flips and shows you the harsh reality.
When you're pretending to be asleep, but your mom still finds a way to wake you up for morning devotion.
When you're trying to act cool in front of your crush, but end up tripping over your own feet.
When you're trying to explain something to your parents, but they still don't understand and say 'It's because of that phone.'
When you finally get a chance to eat your favorite food, but someone else finishes it before you get there.
When you're trying to take a group photo, but there's always that one person who blinks at the wrong time.
When you're trying to make small talk with someone, but all you can think of is 'So... how's the weather?'
When you're trying to be productive, but end up spending hours scrolling through memes instead.
When you're trying to sneak a snack at night, but the wrapper makes the loudest noise ever.
When you're trying to be healthy, but the smell of freshly baked bread hits you like a truck.
When you're trying to act like an adult, but still get excited when you see a bouncy castle.
When you're trying to be serious, but your friend makes a joke and you can't stop laughing.
When you're trying to study, but your pet decides it's the perfect time for a cuddle.
When you're trying to save money, but there's a sale and your willpower disappears.
When you're trying to be organized, but end up making a mess instead.
When you're trying to be on time, but everything seems to be working against you.
When you're trying to be polite, but someone keeps interrupting you and you just want to scream.

When you're trying to be cool, but end up spilling something on yourself instead.
When you're trying to impress someone with your cooking skills, but end up burning everything.

When you're trying to be calm, but someone cuts in front of you in line and you lose it.
When you're trying to be responsible, but end up binge-watching a whole season of a show in one night.
